title: pH and pKa of weak acids

content.question: Acid <math alttext="p K a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>p</mi></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H C l O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.92" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H N O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.25</mn></math> <math alttext="H C 3 H 5 O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="4.88" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.88</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H O C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HOCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="7.42" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.42</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Based on the information in the table, which of the following mixtures forms a buffer with a <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> closest to <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
